definition[0]: a small picture, map etc in the corner of a page or larger picture etc, which shows more detail or information
example[0]: The venture earned Mr Taylor (inset) millions of dollars.
definition[1]: something which is fixed into or onto the surface of something else
example[1]: a pendant with a diamond inset
definition[2]: if something is inset with decorations or jewels, they are fixed into or on its surface
example[2]: a wooden box inset with ivory
definition[3]: to put a small picture, map etc on a printed page
definition[4]: (in-service education training) in the UK, training for teachers which takes place during the school year
